_header: We that are here in heavens glory
_description: William Dunbar, ‘The Dregy maid to the kyng’ — 110 lines in couplets and responses of six lines, ababcc

CULLl510.First Lines:
We þat ar heir in heavnis gloirTo ȝow þat ar in
                    purgatorie…
CULLl510.Last Lines:
…et ad edinburgi gaudia feliciter perducasDumbaris dirige to
                    þe kingBydand our lang in sterreling
CULLl510.Attributed Author: Dumbar (see last line above, couplet unique to this MS)

CamMagPep2553.First Lines:
We þat ar heir in hevynnis glorieTo ȝou þat ar in
                    purgatorie…
CamMagPep2553.Last Lines:
…Et nos Inducas in tentationem de stirlingSed libera nos a
                        malo eiusdemDumbaris dirige to þe kingBydand ouir lang in
                    stirling
CamMagPep2553.Attributed Author:
Dumbaris dirige to þe king / Bydand ouir lang in stirling (p.
                    292)
CamMagPep2553.Attributed Title:
Dumbaris dirige to þe king / Bydand ouir lang in stirling (p.
                    292)
CamMagPep2553.Editions:
Craigie,  William Alexander. 
             The Maitland Folio Manuscript, Containing Poems by Sir Richard
                Maitland, Dunbar, Douglas, Henryson, and others.
             2 vols. 
             Scottish Text Society
         n.s. 7 (1919), 20 (1927); Edinburgh and London: Blackwood, 1919,
            1927: 1.337-41.

Banna.First Lines:
We that ar heir in hevins gloryTo ȝow þat ar in
                    purgatory…
Banna.Last Lines:
…Et ad edinburgi gaudia eos perducasVt requiescat striuilling
                    amen
Banna.Attributed Title:
The dregy of dunbar maid to king Iames þe fyist being in striuilling
                    (f. 102); Heir endis dumbaris dergy to the king bydand to lang in stirling (f.
                        103v)
